pros: Staff at Centres tend to be amazing to work with. Being supportive and friendly.
cons:
HR and management. 
Communication between employees and updating them with key information.

review_title: The staff are great but the managing director only sees staff as a number.
pros:
Staff on site are good
Sick pay
cons:
Payroll regularly pay you wrong and won't correct it.
If you go against higher management you are labelled as a terrorist.
You are treated a just a number and loyalty is not rewarded.
Money is more important than standards.
COVID has destroyed what used to be a great place of work with great staff, this organisation is a shell.of what it once was and is not a company i would recommend working for.

job_title: Lifegurd & Swim Instructor in Goole, England
pros: Flexible company who will aim to make time and asjust rotas for family life
cons: Inconsistent wages and all decisions have to be run by head office. No site control

pros: Low expectations from managment as long as no complaints received
cons:
managers have a 'us and them' attitude.
little chance of making a career due to managers selecting applicants for promotions before being advertised.
only fitness staff offered training due to saleability of fitness classess

pros: Difficult but rewarding job as a manager
cons: Expected to do more and more every year. More than what you are paid.

job_title: Receptionist in Leigh, North West England, England
cons: Senior managers lack people skills. Shocking levels of communication. No consideration for the healthy lifestyles of their employees. Lack of training for new people.
